title: BLACKPINK’s 2025 Tour: How to Get Tickets to Sold-Out Shows
description: BLACKPINK's 2025 tour includes four North American stops in Los Angeles, Chicago, Toronto, and New York. Learn how to get tickets to sold-out shows here. BLACKPINK’s 2025 Tour: How to Get Tickets to Sold-Out Shows Mary Siroky
author: Mary Siroky
excerpt: BLACKPINK's 2025 world tour includes four North American concerts in Los Angeles, Chicago, Toronto, and New York. Learn how to get tickets to sold-out shows.
text: The members of BLACKPINK —  Jisoo, Jennie, Rosé, and Lisa — are returning to the road for a much-anticipated tour in summer 2025 Get BLACKPINK Tickets Here The members have mapped out a 2025 world tour; while the limited run currently has the record-breaking K-pop act hitting nine cities, they’ll be at some of the largest venues in their career as BLACKPINK. The tour kicks off in July in Seoul, with concerts in the US and Canada to follow. It’s then set to wrap up the following month when they become the first K-pop girl group to headline Wembley Stadium. Find details on the tour below, and get tickets here. How Can I Buy Tickets to the 2025 BLACKPINK Tour — Even to Sold-Out Concerts? Tickets for BLACKPINK’s upcoming world tour went on sale Thursday, February 27th and instantly sold out. However, BLINKS can look for deals or get tickets to sold-out shows via StubHub, where orders are 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s FanProtect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand. The 2025 BLACKPINK world tour is set to kick off with two nights in their home base of Seoul at Goyang Stadium with two back to back shows on July 5th and 6th. The North American run will take place shortly after, with the members hitting the massive SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles. Then, they’ll visit Chicago’s Soldier Field, Toronto’s Rogers Stadium, and Citi Field in New York. The 2025 tour will wrap with a handful of dates in Europe, concluding with a triumphant evening at the iconic Wembley Stadium. Additionally, the group has already confirmed 2026 dates, with three nights in Tokyo slated for January 2026. The teaser video for the tour has hinted at more dates to come. Who Is Opening for BLACKPINK on Their 2025 Tour? It is likely that BLACKPINK will not have an opening act, as most K-pop groups opt to tour without support or additional guests. Will BLACKPINK Release New Music in 2025? In a recent interview, Rosé teased new music on the way from the group as a whole. In recent months, the members have been busy rolling out solo projects, including Rosé’s chart-topping collaboration with Bruno Mars, Jisoo’s solo EP, and a fun string of singles from both Jennie and Lisa ahead of individual albums. What Are BLACKPINK’s 2025 Tour Dates? Grab tickets to see BLACKPINK live on stage StubHub. BLACKPINK 2025 – 2026 Tour Dates: 07/05 07/06 – Seoul, KR @ Goyang Stadium 07/12 – Los Angeles, CA @ SoFi Stadium 07/18 – Chicago, IL @ Soldier Field Stadium 07/22 – Toronto, ON, CA @ Rogers Stadium 07/26 – New York, NY @ Citi Field 08/02 – Paris, FR @ Stade de France 08/06 – Milan, IT @ Ippodromo SNAI La Maura 08/09 – Barcelona, ES @ Estadi Olímpic 08/15 – London, UK @ Wembley Stadium 01/16 – 01/18 – Tokyo, JP @ Tokyo Dome
html:
The members of BLACKPINK —  Jisoo, Jennie, Rosé, and Lisa — are returning to the road for a much-anticipated tour in summer 2025

Get BLACKPINK Tickets Here

The members have mapped out a 2025 world tour; while the limited run currently has the record-breaking K-pop act hitting nine cities, they’ll be at some of the largest venues in their career as BLACKPINK. The tour kicks off in July in Seoul, with concerts in the US and Canada to follow. It’s then set to wrap up the following month when they become the first K-pop girl group to headline Wembley Stadium.

Find details on the tour below, and get tickets here.

How Can I Buy Tickets to the 2025 BLACKPINK Tour — Even to Sold-Out Concerts?

Tickets for BLACKPINK’s upcoming world tour went on sale Thursday, February 27th and instantly sold out. However, BLINKS can look for deals or get tickets to sold-out shows via StubHub, where orders are 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s FanProtect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand.

The 2025 BLACKPINK world tour is set to kick off with two nights in their home base of Seoul at Goyang Stadium with two back to back shows on July 5th and 6th.

The North American run will take place shortly after, with the members hitting the massive SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles. Then, they’ll visit Chicago’s Soldier Field, Toronto’s Rogers Stadium, and Citi Field in New York.

The 2025 tour will wrap with a handful of dates in Europe, concluding with a triumphant evening at the iconic Wembley Stadium.

Additionally, the group has already confirmed 2026 dates, with three nights in Tokyo slated for January 2026. The teaser video for the tour has hinted at more dates to come.

Who Is Opening for BLACKPINK on Their 2025 Tour?

It is likely that BLACKPINK will not have an opening act, as most K-pop groups opt to tour without support or additional guests.

Will BLACKPINK Release New Music in 2025?

In a recent interview, Rosé teased new music on the way from the group as a whole. In recent months, the members have been busy rolling out solo projects, including Rosé’s chart-topping collaboration with Bruno Mars, Jisoo’s solo EP, and a fun string of singles from both Jennie and Lisa ahead of individual albums.

What Are BLACKPINK’s 2025 Tour Dates?

Grab tickets to see BLACKPINK live on stage StubHub.

BLACKPINK 2025 – 2026 Tour Dates:
07/05 07/06 – Seoul, KR @ Goyang Stadium
07/12 – Los Angeles, CA @ SoFi Stadium
07/18 – Chicago, IL @ Soldier Field Stadium
07/22 – Toronto, ON, CA @ Rogers Stadium
07/26 – New York, NY @ Citi Field
08/02 – Paris, FR @ Stade de France
08/06 – Milan, IT @ Ippodromo SNAI La Maura
08/09 – Barcelona, ES @ Estadi Olímpic
08/15 – London, UK @ Wembley Stadium
01/16 – 01/18 – Tokyo, JP @ Tokyo Dome
